item.title: How Soon Is Now (remixed)
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: The other day I heard an interesting remix of The Smiths’ classic How Soon Is Now on the local college radio station. I should have called the DJ, but I didn’t. So, I finally got around to googling and can’t find the mix I heard, but I did find a couple interesting mixes. I vaguely […]
item.content:encoded:
The other day I heard an interesting remix of The Smiths’ classic How Soon Is Now on the local college radio station. I should have called the DJ, but I didn’t. So, I finally got around to googling and can’t find the mix I heard, but I did find a couple interesting mixes.

I vaguely recall this “Inner Sanctum” remix from the late ’90s.

But, I also stumbled across this interesting Mark Ronson remix that I never knew about. So, it wasn’t a total loss.

Somewhat related, in that it is a remix of a Smiths track, here’s the Forbidden Disco Remix of Barbarism Begins At Home.

item.title: Ulysses remixed
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: mebeliFranz Ferdinand’s new single Ulysses has been given the remix contest treatment and a winner has been crowned. Head over to BeatPortal to hear the winning entry from Keith & Supabeatz.
item.content:encoded: mebeliFranz Ferdinand’s new single Ulysses has been given the remix contest treatment and a winner has been crowned. Head over to BeatPortal to hear the winning entry from Keith & Supabeatz.

item.title: I kissed a remix and I liked it
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: Oh. my. fuck. The Public / McFly remix of Katy Perry’s hit I Kissed a Girl is incredible. Let the bashing begin.
item.content:encoded:
Oh. my. fuck. The Public / McFly remix of Katy Perry’s hit I Kissed a Girl is incredible.

Let the bashing begin.

item.title: Remix Radiohead for Fun and Fame
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: “To make remixing easy, the separate ‘stems’* from the song are available to purchase from iTunes _here_. The ‘stems’ available are bass, voice, guitar, strings/fx and drums. You can mix them in any way you like, either by adding your own beats and instrumentation, or just remixing the original parts.” Wow. They’re selling pieces of […]
item.content:encoded:
“To make remixing easy, the separate ‘stems’* from the song are available to purchase from iTunes _here_. The ‘stems’ available are bass, voice, guitar, strings/fx and drums. You can mix them in any way you like, either by adding your own beats and instrumentation, or just remixing the original parts.”

Wow. They’re selling pieces of songs, now. If that’s not capitalism, I don’t know what is.

item.title: Remixes are for kids #6 – TV On The Radio vs. Bryan Hyde
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: Continuing my occasional remix highlight feature, here’s Bryan Hyde’s reworking of my favorite TV On The Radio track, Staring at the Sun. tv-on-the-radio-staring-at-the-sun-bryan-hyde-remix.mp3
item.content:encoded:
Continuing my occasional remix highlight feature, here’s Bryan Hyde’s reworking of my favorite TV On The Radio track, Staring at the Sun.

tv-on-the-radio-staring-at-the-sun-bryan-hyde-remix.mp3

item.title: Madchester returns with a Whip?
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: Lily Allen recently introduced me to The Whip. Gotta love that girl. The track has already received the remix treatment from a variety of folks, including labelmates, Crookers. The Whip – Trash (Crookers remix)
item.content:encoded:
Lily Allen recently introduced me to The Whip. Gotta love that girl.

The track has already received the remix treatment from a variety of folks, including labelmates, Crookers.

The Whip – Trash (Crookers remix)

item.title: Remixes are for kids #5 – Gang of Four vs. Death Row Archie
item.dc:creator: k
item.description: Yes, it is pretty close to blasphemy to touch a Gang of Four track, especially one as beloved as Outside The Trains Don’t Run On Time, but Death Row Archie does an honorable remixing of this classic track. Outside The Trains Donâ€™t Run On Time (Death Row Archie)
item.content:encoded:
Yes, it is pretty close to blasphemy to touch a Gang of Four track, especially one as beloved as Outside The Trains Don’t Run On Time, but Death Row Archie does an honorable remixing of this classic track.

Outside The Trains Donâ€t Run On Time (Death Row Archie)
